item.title: Cross-Platform Age Verification in .NET MAUI Applications
item.description: If you're building apps that need to comply with upcoming age verification requirements in Texas (January 1, 2026), Utah (May 7, 2026), or Louisiana (July 1, 2026), you might be wondering how to handle age verification across Android, iOS, and Windows. The good news? Each platform provides its own age verification APIs, and we've put togeth Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/cross-platform-age-verification-dotnet-maui

item.title: How do I get my edit control text to be autoselected when I choose it to be the default focus in my dialog?
item.description: A customer had a Win32 dialog with a bunch of edit controls inside. In their WM_INIT­DIALOG message handler, they filled those edit controls with information and then decided which one should get initial focus when the dialog is shown to the user. To set the focus, they did SetFocus(GetDlgItem(hDlg, initialCon Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251201-00/?p=111825

item.title: How can I have a Win32 drop-down combo box with a read-only edit control?
item.description: A customer was writing a Win32 program and was looking for something like a combo box, in that it gave the user a choice among various fixed options, but sometimes the program would come up with a new option that wasn't on the list, and it would want to show that as the selection. On the other hand, the customer didn't want to give the user Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251128-00/?p=111820

item.title: Announcing ASP.NET Core OData 10.0.0 Preview 1
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the release of ASP.NET Core OData 10.0.0 Preview 1, a major modernization update that embraces .NET's native System.DateOnly and System.TimeOnly types! This release upgrades to .NET 10.0 and replaces OData's proprietary Edm.Date and Edm.TimeOfDay CL Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/odata/announcing-asp-net-core-odata-10-0-0-preview-1

item.title: Message-only windows are for messaging, not as a convenient victim for hosting UI
item.description: A customer wanted to show a dialog box, but they didn't want it to be attached to any of their existing windows because it was a general dialog that applied to all of their windows. So they had a great idea: Their program already had a message-only window, so they figured, "Hey, I already have this garbage window I can use as the owner of s Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251127-00/?p=111817

item.title: .NET Day on Agentic Modernization Coming Soon
item.description: Join us on December 9, 2025 between 9AM-1PM Pacific for .NET Day of Agentic Modernization! This is a free, one-day virtual event focused on the latest tooling, techniques, and guidance for modernizing your .NET applications. Whether you're upgrading legacy code, preparing for cloud workloads, Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/dotnet-day-on-agentic-modernization-coming-soon

item.title: Azure SDK Release (November 2025)

Subscribe to our Azure SDK Blog RSS Feed to get notified when a new release is available. item.title: Manage Containers the Easy Way: Copilot + VS Code
item.description: Managing containers can be one of the most repetitive parts of modern development. Between remembering CLI commands, switching contexts, and digging through logs, it’s easy to lose focus on the actual code you’re building. The latest release of the VS Code Container Tools extension changes that by putting Copilot directly Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/manage-containers-the-easy-way-copilot-vs-code

item.title: Celebrating Community Contributions in Aspire 13
item.description: Aspire 13.0 marks a major milestone, not just for the product, but for the vibrant community that helped shape it. This release includes meaningful contributions from community members across features, integrations, tooling, and documentation. We wanted to highlight some standout PRs from this release as a way to say thanks, and hopefully i Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/aspire/thanksgiving-contributions

item.title: Introducing Multi-Agent Workflows in Foundry Agent Service
item.description: Across industries, organizations are moving from experimenting with single agents to running AI at the center of their business operations. While single agents excel at focused tasks, customers quickly discover that real enterprise work stretches across multiple steps, involves different roles, and requires strong governance. To operationalize Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/foundry/introducing-multi-agent-workflows-in-foundry-agent-service

item.description: Starting with Visual Studio 2026, we are introducing a new support lifecycle for the Microsoft C++ (MSVC) Build Tools. We are also updating the MSVC release cadence. item.title: Visual Studio – Built for the Speed of Modern Development
item.description: The release of Visual Studio 2026 two weeks ago marks the next evolution in Microsoft’s 50-year commitment to deliver the tools that developers love and enterprises trust, built to move at the pace of modern development. Software development is moving faster than ever, and Visual Studio is evolving right along with you. Today, we’re ann Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/visual-studio-built-for-the-speed-of-modern-development

item.title: Why does XAML break down when I have an element that is half a billion pixels tall?
item.description: A customer reported that their program encountered rendering problems when they created elements that were a half billion pixels tall, and they wondered why this was happening. A half billion pixels is an awful lot of pixels. At 96 pixels per inch, that gives you an element whose height is over 82 miles (132 km). There is no monitor Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251124-00/?p=111811

item.title: SharePoint Site Creation in Microsoft Graph
item.description: The SharePoint team is excited to (finally) bring Site Collection creation to Graph! Starting in Microsoft Graph beta you can now create new site collections! But that’s not all! Creating site collections through older APIs required that your application have Si Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/sharepoint-site-creation-in-microsoft-graph
